results.title: Cartes postales video
results.brief_description: The conventions and style of the postcard’s photographic moment are transformed by movement and sound in this exquisite collection of thirty-second video postcards. Time worn images fade in, only to be suddenly and momentarily released with a gesture, a punctuating sound - and then frozen again. Witty and often poignant, these revealing documents of time, place and memory capture a fleeting, ephemeral reality. We are invited into a narrative of what the artist calls ‘thirty seconds worth of dreams’. Produced in Paris, New York, Rome, Quebec, Iceland, Lisbon, Cairo, Algiers, and other sites around the world, these video postcards form fragments a perceptual voyage by way of the subtle magic of a temporal trompe l’oeil.

results.title: The Consequences of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Ross Christopher and Australian National University
results.brief_description: Highlights of a conference, with the same name as the title, which was held at the Australian National University. The papers dealt with various aspects of the nuclear arms race and were presented by a range of Australian and international speakers.
results.description: Highlights of a conference, with the same name as the title, which was held at the Australian National University. The papers dealt with various aspects of the nuclear arms race and were presented by a range of Australian and international speakers.

results.title: Making the most of the micro 6-10
results.brief_description: Sequel to Parts 1-5 of the same title. Part 6: “Getting down to business” examines the pros and cons of system design and the role of expert advice from commercial software houses. 7: “Sounds interesting” addresses the micro making sounds and music. 8: “Everything under control” discusses the micro controlling equipment. 9: “Moving pictures”. 10: “At the end of the line” is about telephones and micros.

results.title: Compilation Ultimate skills
results.brief_description: Ultimate skills (Australia): Three motorcycle champions explain and demonstrate their skills at trail riding, motocross and road riding. 2.” Survival of the fastest” (U.K.): Shows the evolution of the motorcycle from a primitive machine into a glamorous, sophisticated piece of engineering. Looks at research and development and compares British and Japanese bikes.

results.title: The Sydney Opera House Tenth Anniversary Recital: Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Peter Abbott, Yoho Productions and Peter Skillman
results.brief_description: Roper Woodward played the first recital at the Sydney Opera House in 1973 and ten years later he was given the honour of performing the tenth anniversary recital on October 1, 1983. This video presents Roger Woodward performing the commemorative tenth recital live at the Sydney Opera House playing three of Beethoven’s sonatas and ending with an encore of Chopin’s Grand Waltz.

results.title: Game girls: Heathens
results.brief_description: This tape contains two short documentaries about the culture surrounding football. “Game girls” (directed by Miriam Cannell), follows the role of women in Australian football and the often silent but loudly significant role they have played. Rated PG. “Heathens” (directed by Megan Spencer), confirms that there are really passionate and vitriolic supporters out there as director Megan Spencer follows St Kilda supporters with names like Thommo and Chook. Watch out for the language, which is alot more colourful than the red white and black. Rated R, for reasons which become very apparent from the first five seconds.

results.title: Chocolates, giants and peaches. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Roald Dahl, recorded live at the Dallas Brooks Hall in Melbourne, talks about his writing and reads aloud from his own books, including Revolting Rhymes”, “BFG”, “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory”, “Matilda and “Dirty Beasts”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner

results.title: The Esso Australian Jazz Summit
results.brief_description: Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach came alive with a foot-tapping, head-nodding event, the First Australian Jazz Summit. All styles of jazz were represented, from modern, traditional through to avant-garde. Various ensembles and configurations of players performed, from standard groups to Big Bands, feature soloists and, of course, jam sessions and improvisation. Rated: G

results.title: One another
results.brief_description:
Two protagonists search for themselves/each other within morphing boundaries and shifting skies.
Charcoal drawing on erasure stop frame animation with live action video.
Music composed by Joseph Tawadros and performed by Joseph Tawadros, James Tawadros and Ben Rodgers.
